alert.note: Alert for Dinwiddie; Prince George; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 8:08PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Showers with brief gusty winds will impact portions of southwestern Prince George, western Sussex and Dinwiddie Counties through 845 PM EDT... At 806 PM EDT, Doppler radar was showers centered near Wilsons, or 8 miles north of McKenney, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. The showers will be near... McKenney around 815 PM EDT. Dinwiddie and Dewitt around 820 PM EDT. Carson around 840 PM EDT. Stony Creek around 845 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these showers include Burgess, Reams, Wharfs Store, Huske, Darvills, Center Star, Petersburg Airport, Church Road, Owens and Five Forks. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these showers. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
